Resolution No. 27056 (New Series).
Upon recommendation of the City •

BE IT

half of the City and County of San
Francisco,
duplicate counterparts
of proposed

mita Park, in the County of San

cipal Air Port.

Resolution No. 27073 (New Series).
Upon recommendation of the City
Engineer, BE IT RESOLVED that
the Mayor and the Clerk of the
Board of Supervisors
are hereby
authorized and directed to execute
in behalf of the City and County of
San
Francisco, duplicate counter-
parts of proposed
agreement be-
tween MARKET STREET RAIL-
WAY COMPANY, a corporation, the
party of the first part, and CITY
AND COUNTY
OF SAN
FRAN-
CISCO, a municipal corporation, the
party of the second part, permitting
the
City the right to
construct,
maintain and operate a three-inch
(3") water pipe line beneath the
Market Street Railway Company's
street car tracks near Lomita Park,
in the County of San Mateo, State
of California, to be used in connec-
tion with the Municipal Air Port.
Adopted — Board of Supervisors,
San Francisco, April 4, 1927.
Ayes: Supervisors Byington, Col-
Havennet, Hayden ent Marks,
Havenner,
Kent, Marks,
MeSheehy, Powers, Roncovieri,
Schmidt, Shannon, Stanton, Todd.
Absent: Supervisors Badaracco,
Bath,
J. S. DUNNIGAN,
Clerk.
Approved, San Francisco, April 8,
1927.
JAMES ROLPH, JR.,

properties.sfomuseum:airport: Mills Field Municipal Airport of San Francisco
properties.sfomuseum:creditline: Transfer from City and County of San Francisco
properties.sfomuseum:description: Collection of newsprint clippings containing airport resolutions:a. Bill No. 7914, Ordinance No. 7428, “Authorizing and directing the mayor and clerk of the Board of Supervisors to execute a lease in behalf of the city and county of San Francisco with the Mills Estate Inc. for certain lands situated in the county of San Mateo, State of CA., required for Airport purposes”;b. Copy of Bill No. 7914;c. Five copies of Resolution No. 27056, “Mayor and clerk of Board of Supervisors are authorized and directed to maintain and operate on behalf of City and County of San Francisco a 3 inch waterpipe beneath Southern Pacific Company's right of way near Lomita Park, San Mateo. Permission to construct had been given by Southern Pacific Company”;d. Five copies of Resolution No. 27075, “Agreement between City of San Francisco and Market Street Railway Company permitting the City the right to construct, maintain and operate three inch water pipe beneath street car tracks near Lomita Park, San Mateo”;e. Envelope with return address to City Attorney, San Francisco, and typed caption, “Air Port Resolutions”.
properties.wof:name: newspaper clippings: airport resolutions, Mills Field Municipal Airport of San Francisco
